name: Guowei Yang 0001
content: Guowei Yang's Home Page Home Publications Teaching Software Service Guowei Yang Senior Lecturer (U.S. Associate Professor) School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Faculty of Engineering, Architecture and Information Technology The University of Queensland Email: guowei.yang@uq.edu.au Multiple scholarships are available! I am looking for highly motivated students (including PhDs, Masters, undergraduates), and visitors to join my research group. If you are interested and have background in software engineering, AI, and/or programming languages (such as machine learning system reliability and LLM4Code), please send an email with your CV to guowei.yang@uq.edu.au. The University of Queensland is ranked in the top 50 globally according to major ranking systems, such as QS (42) and U.S. News (43). News One paper on enhancing LLM code generation with ensembles is accepted to ICSE'26. One paper on automated update of Android deprecated API usages is accepted to IEEE TSE. One paper on empirical evaluation of Android app testing practices is accepted to Springer EMSE. One paper on document-guided fuzzing of deep learning liblibraries is accepted to ISSRE'25. Invited to serve on the FSE'26 program committee. One paper on document-guided fuzzing of OpenCV library is accepted to ICSME'25. One paper on dynamic command generation for information theft attacks in LLM tool-learning system is accepted to ACL'25. Invited to serve on the ASE'25 program committee. One paper on testing Android third party libraries with LLMs is accepted to FORGE'25. Invited to serve on the ICSE'26 program committee. One paper on automated patch generation is accepted to ASE'24. One paper on Android app testing practices is accepted to ISSRE'24. One paper on Android API field evolution is accepted to IST. Invited to serve on the FSE'25 program committee. Invited to serve on the ISSTA'25 program committee. One paper on compatible branch coverage driven symbolic execution is accepted to PLDI'24. Invited to serve on the ICSE'25 program committee. Invited to serve on the ISSTA'24 program committee. One paper on concrete constraint guided symbolic execution is accepted to ICSE'24. One paper on JVM Fuzzing is accepted to ESEC/FSE'23. One paper on mining online discussions to enrich secure coding practices is accepted to ASE'23. Invited to serve on the FSE'24 program committee. One paper on Android API compatibility issues detection is accepted to IEEE TSE. Invited to serve on the ASE'23 program committee. Short Bio Guowei Yang is a Senior Lecturer (equal to U.S Associate Professor) in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at The University of Queensland, Australia. His research interests lie in Software Engineering, and its synergy with Machine Learning and Programming Languages, with a focus on improving reliability and security of software and machine learning systems. Prior to joining UQ in 2021, Guowei was a tenured Associate Professor at Texas State University in USA. He received his Ph.D. from The University of Texas at Austin in 2013.
